definition: to fish up/to dredge up
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to salvage/to dredge/to fish out (person or object from the sea)
to fish for (aquatic animals and plants)/to catch
to fish for/to seek profit (by improper means)
to profiteer/to gain some underhand advantage
lit. to fish a needle from the sea/to find a needle in a haystack (idiom)
to get one's money back (esp. gambling)/to recoup one's losings
to make extra money
lit. to scoop the moon out of the water (idiom)/a hopeless endeavor
see 水中撈月|水中捞月[shui3 zhong1 lao1 yue4]
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
see 大海撈針|大海捞针[da4 hai3 lao1 zhen1]
fishing (as a commercial activity)
(fig.) to clutch at straws (in desperation)/to take advantage of the situation (unscrupulously)
encumbrance/burden/that awful thing (colloquial)/nuisance
lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck

sentences.english: A group of uninteresting people fishing fishing profits vampire son of the SA.
sentences.chinese: 一羣無趣的撈名撈利的吸血的瘙子。

sentences.english: The sand bailer is also used as a bottom hole sampler.
sentences.chinese: 撈砂筒也可用作業井底取樣器。

sentences.english: A wireline bailer that is used to remove sand and debris from the bottom of a well.
sentences.chinese: 從井底去除砂子和碎片所用的由鋼絲繩起下的撈砂筒。

sentences.english: These people must pay the restaurants and hotels money each month.
sentences.chinese: 這些撈油的人每個月都要給酒樓一些錢。

sentences.english: How much is waiting for you to catch?
sentences.chinese: 外面有多少錢等着你去撈？

sentences.english: We quickly pulled the moon Come.
sentences.chinese: 我們趕快把月亮撈上來吧。

sentences.english: I'll get the cast and go for sardines. Will you sit in the sun in the doorway?
sentences.chinese: 我拿魚網撈沙丁魚去。你坐在門口曬曬太陽可好？

sentences.english: Add in coconut shreds and hazelnut powder.
sentences.chinese: 加入椰絲和榛子粉，用橡膠刮刀撈拌均勻。

sentences.english: Will you Strike it Lucky, catch Gold Fever or be left bankrupt?
sentences.chinese: 你會行使其瑞，撈金髮熱或留待破產嗎？

sentences.english: Our friend nets the fish himself and then hammars its head with handle!
sentences.chinese: 某兄就用網進去撈，用把手敲魚的頭。

sentences.english: We went out in Daddy's small boat and got some of the logs and took them ashore.
sentences.chinese: 我們乘爹地的小船撈到一些圓木，帶到岸上。

sentences.english: People who win the lottery spend all their money and end up depressed.
sentences.chinese: 中了大獎的人把錢花乾淨了，最後撈了個空落落。

sentences.english: You cannot catch a fish without being near the water.
"The D dint got apt obtain a head later above, " whatsoever, what does this have afresh.
sentences.chinese: 隨後丁力撈了撈頭，“不過，這又有什麼呢。

sentences.english: Somebody keeps going into my desk and pinching my pencils.
sentences.chinese: 有人老是伸手到我書桌裏來把我的鉛筆撈了去。

sentences.english: Dumpling boiled dumplings, after mother put out.
sentences.chinese: 餃子煮好以後，媽媽把餃子撈出來。

pot/pan/boiler/CL:口[kou3],隻|只[zhi1]
to choose/to pick/to sort out/to pick up
to scald/to burn (by scalding)/to blanch (cooking)/to heat (sth) up in hot water/to perm/to iron/scalding hot
to disturb/to annoy/to mix/to stir
see 蝦蟆|虾蟆[ha2 ma5]
shrimp/prawn
shell/carapace/crust (earth's crust etc)/also pr. [ke2]
(it's) no wonder (that...)/(it's) not surprising (that)
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
soft/mushy/well-cooked and soft/to rot/to decompose/rotten/worn out/chaotic/messy/utterly/thoroughly/crappy/bad
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
bored/depressed/melancholy/sealed/airtight/tightly closed
stuffy/shut indoors/to smother/to cover tightly
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
(chicken) egg/hen's egg/CL:個|个[ge4],打[da2]
